Claim: Chinese elderly couple infected with coronavirus says goodbye while they are in a hospital.
Explaination: The elderly couple hospitalized for other conditions such as lung cancer and respiratory failure.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Chinese elderly couple infected with coronavirus says goodbye while they are in a hospital.

Explanation:The elderly couple hospitalized for other conditions such as lung cancer and respiratory failure.

https://spondeomedia.com/falso-adultos-mayores-con-coronavirus-en-hospital/

Claim: Coronavirus has gripped Italy and nobody is willing to carry corpses off Italy’s streets.
Explaination: The photo was taken on March 24, 2014 in Frankfurt, Germany. People lay down on a pedestrian area to remember victims who lost their lives in a Nazi concentration camp.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Coronavirus has gripped Italy and nobody is willing to carry corpses off Italy’s streets.

Explanation:The photo was taken on March 24, 2014 in Frankfurt, Germany. People lay down on a pedestrian area to remember victims who lost their lives in a Nazi concentration camp.

https://www.boomlive.in/fast-check/no-this-photo-does-not-show-dead-bodies-from-the-coronavirus-in-italy-7325

Claim: A video has been viewed in multiple Facebook posts and claims to show a man wiping his sweat on the buttons of a lift in a residential block in Hong Kong.
Explaination: The claim is false; the footage has circulated in media reports about an incident in Thailand.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A video has been viewed in multiple Facebook posts and claims to show a man wiping his sweat on the buttons of a lift in a residential block in Hong Kong.

Explanation:The claim is false; the footage has circulated in media reports about an incident in Thailand.

https://factcheck.afp.com/video-has-circulated-media-reports-about-incident-thailand

Claim: Chinese converting to Islam after realizing that no Muslim was affected by COVD19 in the country.
Explaination: Viral video is available on the internet since June 2019 and has no relation with the current outbreak of coronavirus in China.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Chinese converting to Islam after realizing that no Muslim was affected by COVD19 in the country.

Explanation:Viral video is available on the internet since June 2019 and has no relation with the current outbreak of coronavirus in China.

https://english.factcrescendo.com/2020/02/20/chinese-people-converting-to-islam-in-fear-of-coronavirus/

Claim: A video that claims to feature one of the victims of the new coronavirus.
Explaination: The same video was posted YouTube on October 24th, 2019, which was before the first case of coronavirus got reported in China in December 2019.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A video that claims to feature one of the victims of the new coronavirus.

Explanation:The same video was posted YouTube on October 24th, 2019, which was before the first case of coronavirus got reported in China in December 2019.

http://newsmobile.in/articles/2020/01/28/this-viral-video-is-not-related-to-the-coronavirus-heres-the-fact-check/

Claim: Uber suspends night services in Kenya.
Explaination: Uber has responded to the post online saying that its services were still available to users after 7pm in Kenya, and had not been suspended as claimed.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Uber suspends night services in Kenya.

Explanation:Uber has responded to the post online saying that its services were still available to users after 7pm in Kenya, and had not been suspended as claimed.

https://pesacheck.org/false-uber-has-not-suspended-night-services-in-kenya-9ddbe374b30?source=rss----ab41f21aa9a9---4

Claim: Last picture of Indonesian Dr. Hadio Alo bidding farewell to his family.
Explaination: This image was uploaded in Malaysia and this is not related to Indonesia.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Last picture of Indonesian Dr. Hadio Alo bidding farewell to his family.

Explanation:This image was uploaded in Malaysia and this is not related to Indonesia.

https://srilanka.factcrescendo.com/tamil/fact-check-is-that-last-picture-of-indonesian-doctor-hadio-ali/

Claim: Muslim owned restaurants in Bengaluru have chefs brainwashed by Markaz attendees and are spreading Coronavirus by spitting in the food.
Explaination: The video is old and has nothing to do with the ongoing Nizamuddin Markaz controversy or Indian Muslim restaurant staff. Hence the claim is ‘Misleading’.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: Muslim owned restaurants in Bengaluru have chefs brainwashed by Markaz attendees and are spreading Coronavirus by spitting in the food.

Explanation:The video is old and has nothing to do with the ongoing Nizamuddin Markaz controversy or Indian Muslim restaurant staff. Hence the claim is ‘Misleading’.

https://www.newschecker.in/article/news-detail/275_15553059

Explaination: Please click the link to read the full article
Label: FALSE
html:
Claim: Coronavirus will not be covered by private health insurance in Ecuador.

Explanation:Please click the link to read the full article

http://www.ecuadorchequea.com/las-mentiras-sobre-el-covid-19-en-ecuador/

Claim: Empty hospital lots and waiting rooms are indicative of a coronavirus hoax.
Explaination: No evidence cited, no authorities interviewed and didn't go into hospitals.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Empty hospital lots and waiting rooms are indicative of a coronavirus hoax.

Explanation:No evidence cited, no authorities interviewed and didn't go into hospitals.

https://leadstories.com/hoax-alert/2020/04/Fact-Check-COVID-19-Is-NOT-A-Hoax-Proven-By-Empty-Hospital-Lots-Waiting-Rooms.html

Claim: Policemen in China chase COVID-19 in a subway station.
Explaination: Please click the link to read the full article

html:
Claim: Policemen in China chase COVID-19 in a subway station.

Explanation:Please click the link to read the full article

http://www.ecuadorchequea.com/las-mentiras-sobre-el-covid-19-en-ecuador/

Claim: A photo shows a Japanese medical professional providing aid in Wuhan.
Explaination: This photo has circulated in reports about a Japanese medical team travelling to China in 2008.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A photo shows a Japanese medical professional providing aid in Wuhan.

Explanation:This photo has circulated in reports about a Japanese medical team travelling to China in 2008.

http://u.afp.com/japanmedicalteam

Claim: A photo of COVID-19 patients lying on beds in an isolation ward in Pakistan.
Explaination: The photo is two years old and has nothing to do with COVID-19.
Label: Mostly false
html:
Claim: A photo of COVID-19 patients lying on beds in an isolation ward in Pakistan.

Explanation:The photo is two years old and has nothing to do with COVID-19.

https://aajtak.intoday.in/story/fact-check-pakistan-corona-patient-isolation-ward-covid-19-hospital-social-media-viral-post-1-1176499.html

Claim: The health insurance industry has “agreed to waive all co-payments for coronavirus treatments.”
Explaination: Health insurance companies said they will waive costs for coronavirus tests, not treatment. A shortage in diagnostic supplies means that testing is limited.
Label: False
html:
Claim: The health insurance industry has “agreed to waive all co-payments for coronavirus treatments.”

Explanation:Health insurance companies said they will waive costs for coronavirus tests, not treatment. A shortage in diagnostic supplies means that testing is limited.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/12/donald-trump/trump-wrongly-said-health-insurance-companies-will/

Claim: Close-up of a bat soup bowl eaten in Wuhan, or elsewhere in China.
Explaination: A local source in Palau said he recognized a specific local restaurant. Table, room setting and plates' decorations match with other pictures found online showing tourist dining in unspecified restaurant in Palau. Not enough elements for us to call it false but pretty close.
Label: No evidence
html:
Claim: Close-up of a bat soup bowl eaten in Wuhan, or elsewhere in China.

Explanation:A local source in Palau said he recognized a specific local restaurant. Table, room setting and plates' decorations match with other pictures found online showing tourist dining in unspecified restaurant in Palau. Not enough elements for us to call it false but pretty close.

https://observers.france24.com/fr/20200130-intox-chine-soupe-chauve-souris-rumeur-origine-coronavirus?check=2

Claim: Two photos showing notes scattered on a street have been shared hundreds of times on Facebook and YouTube alongside a claim they were taken in Italy during the novel coronavirus pandemic. The posts claim Italians have thrown money out of their homes in a symbolic gesture to highlight that money is futile during the pandemic.
Explaination: The claim is false; the photos have circulated online since at least March 2019 in reports about two separate incidents in Venezuela.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Two photos showing notes scattered on a street have been shared hundreds of times on Facebook and YouTube alongside a claim they were taken in Italy during the novel coronavirus pandemic. The posts claim Italians have thrown money out of their homes in a symbolic gesture to highlight that money is futile during the pandemic.

Explanation:The claim is false; the photos have circulated online since at least March 2019 in reports about two separate incidents in Venezuela.

https://factcheck.afp.com/these-photos-have-circulated-online-least-march-2019-covid-19-pandemic

Claim: A photo showing Uganda’s first case of COVID-19.
Explaination: The photo of a man wearing a mask does not show Uganda's first COVID-19 case, but was actually taken at the John F Kennedy International Airport in February 2020.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A photo showing Uganda’s first case of COVID-19.

Explanation:The photo of a man wearing a mask does not show Uganda's first COVID-19 case, but was actually taken at the John F Kennedy International Airport in February 2020.

https://pesacheck.org/false-this-man-wearing-a-face-mask-is-not-ugandas-first-confirmed-covid-19-case-1b1e29fc40c9?source=rss----ab41f21aa9a9---4

Claim: A video purports to show body bags for virus victims in Italy.
Explaination: It has previously circulated in media reports about people who died after contracting COVID-19 in Iran; a man recording the video can be heard stating that he is inside a mortuary in the Iranian city of Qom.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: A video purports to show body bags for virus victims in Italy.

Explanation:It has previously circulated in media reports about people who died after contracting COVID-19 in Iran; a man recording the video can be heard stating that he is inside a mortuary in the Iranian city of Qom.

https://factcheck.afp.com/video-has-circulated-media-reports-about-coronavirus-deaths-iran

Claim: A video viewed thousands of times in Nigeria and shared in multiple Facebook posts claims to show police in Spain rounding up people aged 50 and above to transfer them to quarantine centers amid the novel coronavirus pandemic.
Explaination: The claim is false; the footage was circulating months before the outbreak and actually shows police in Azerbaijan detaining anti-government protesters in the capital Baku.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A video viewed thousands of times in Nigeria and shared in multiple Facebook posts claims to show police in Spain rounding up people aged 50 and above to transfer them to quarantine centers amid the novel coronavirus pandemic.

Explanation:The claim is false; the footage was circulating months before the outbreak and actually shows police in Azerbaijan detaining anti-government protesters in the capital Baku.

https://factcheck.afp.com/video-was-shot-azerbaijan-october-2019-during-anti-government-protest

Claim: Photo shows Italians prostrating themselves and praying to Allah, during the coronavirus crisis.
Explaination: The photo is from a Christian prayer vigil in Lima, Peru, on the night of 6 and 7 December 2019. It has nothing to do with the coronavirus, and doesn't show Italians converted to Islam.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Photo shows Italians prostrating themselves and praying to Allah, during the coronavirus crisis.

Explanation:The photo is from a Christian prayer vigil in Lima, Peru, on the night of 6 and 7 December 2019. It has nothing to do with the coronavirus, and doesn't show Italians converted to Islam.

https://africacheck.org/fbcheck/no-video-of-vigil-in-peru-before-coronavirus-not-italians-praying-for-forgiveness/

Claim: People infected with coronavirus die in the street while doctors travel through the infection zone.
Explaination: Both images belong to different events. The first photo corresponds to a performance in Germany and the second photo portrays two doctors who care for Ebola sufferers in Uganda.
Label: False
html:
Claim: People infected with coronavirus die in the street while doctors travel through the infection zone.

Explanation:Both images belong to different events. The first photo corresponds to a performance in Germany and the second photo portrays two doctors who care for Ebola sufferers in Uganda.

https://spondeomedia.com/falso-muertos-por-coronavirus-y-medicos-en-zona-de-contagio/

Claim: People rioting on the streets of London due to economic crisis in the wake of coronavirus outbreak.
Explaination: The viral video is almost nine years old and from the London riots in 2011.
Label: False
html:
Claim: People rioting on the streets of London due to economic crisis in the wake of coronavirus outbreak.

Explanation:The viral video is almost nine years old and from the London riots in 2011.

https://www.indiatoday.in/fact-check/story/fact-check-truth-behind-video-people-rioting-on-london-streets-fearing-coronavirus-lockdown-1658310-2020-03-22

Claim: Photo shows coffins from coronavirus outbreak in Italy.
Explaination: Old photo from African migrants who died from shipwreck in 2013.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Photo shows coffins from coronavirus outbreak in Italy.

Explanation:Old photo from African migrants who died from shipwreck in 2013.

https://hoax-alert.leadstories.com/3472038-Fact-Check-Photo-Does-NOT-Show-Coffins-Of-Dozens-Of-COVID19-Victims.html

Claim: All fruit and vegetable markets in the Indian city of Chennai and across the state of Tamil Nadu have been ordered to close in an effort to curb the spread of the novel coronavirus.
Explaination: The claim is false; Chennai’s municipal authority called the social media posts “fake”, and Tamil Nadu’s chief minister said that stores selling “essential items” such as groceries are allowed to operate as normal despite a nationwide lockdown.
Label: False
html:
Claim: All fruit and vegetable markets in the Indian city of Chennai and across the state of Tamil Nadu have been ordered to close in an effort to curb the spread of the novel coronavirus.

Explanation:The claim is false; Chennai’s municipal authority called the social media posts “fake”, and Tamil Nadu’s chief minister said that stores selling “essential items” such as groceries are allowed to operate as normal despite a nationwide lockdown.

https://factcheck.afp.com/indian-authorities-refute-fake-claim-about-food-markets-closing-chennai-during-covid-19-lockdown

Claim: Photo of people in medical scrubs lying on the floor of an operating theatre shows some of the 200 Italian doctors who died of COVID-19 in one day on 3/23/20.
Explaination: Photo is a still from an episode of US TV drama, Grey's Anatomy. And there is no evidence to show that 200 Italian doctors died on 23 March 2020.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Photo of people in medical scrubs lying on the floor of an operating theatre shows some of the 200 Italian doctors who died of COVID-19 in one day on 3/23/20.

Explanation:Photo is a still from an episode of US TV drama, Grey's Anatomy. And there is no evidence to show that 200 Italian doctors died on 23 March 2020.

https://africacheck.org/fbcheck/photo-not-of-italian-doctors-dead-from-covid-19-its-from-tv-drama-greys-anatomy/

Claim: Some Countries are dumping COVID-19 infected dead bodies in the sea, therefore be careful while consuming sea food.
Explaination: The original video was captured and published in 2014 when dozens of migrant bodies were washed ashore in Libya.
Label: FALSE
html:
Claim: Some Countries are dumping COVID-19 infected dead bodies in the sea, therefore be careful while consuming sea food.

Explanation:The original video was captured and published in 2014 when dozens of migrant bodies were washed ashore in Libya.

https://srilanka.factcrescendo.com/english/fact-check-these-are-not-deceased-covid19-victims-washed-ashore/

Claim: The novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV) “will not last long” in the Philippines because of its warm climate.
Explaination: The World Health Organization (WHO) has not said that temperature affects the spread of 2019-nCoV and they don't recommend exposure to heat as protection or a treatment for the virus.
Label: False
html:
Claim: The novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV) “will not last long” in the Philippines because of its warm climate.

Explanation:The World Health Organization (WHO) has not said that temperature affects the spread of 2019-nCoV and they don't recommend exposure to heat as protection or a treatment for the virus.

https://www.rappler.com/newsbreak/fact-check/250679-coronavirus-eliminated-high-temperatures

Claim: Image with the narration to claim that a huge number of Muslims were roaming in Beruwala City in Sri Lanka during curfew, risking the lives of many amid COVID-19
Explaination: The image was from a large Muslim procession held in March 2019.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Image with the narration to claim that a huge number of Muslims were roaming in Beruwala City in Sri Lanka during curfew, risking the lives of many amid COVID-19

Explanation:The image was from a large Muslim procession held in March 2019.

https://srilanka.factcrescendo.com/2020/03/30/fact-check-a-year-old-image-being-shared-as-recent-from-beruwala/

Claim: A poem about people self-isolating at home has been shared thousands of times on Facebook and Twitter in April 2020 alongside a claim that it was written in the 19th century and reprinted during the 1918 Spanish flu pandemic. The posts, published as the world continued to endure the spread of the novel coronavirus, claim the poem is evidence that “history repeats itself.”
Explaination: The claim is false; the poem was first published online in March 2020 by a retired teacher in the US during the novel coronavirus pandemic.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A poem about people self-isolating at home has been shared thousands of times on Facebook and Twitter in April 2020 alongside a claim that it was written in the 19th century and reprinted during the 1918 Spanish flu pandemic. The posts, published as the world continued to endure the spread of the novel coronavirus, claim the poem is evidence that “history repeats itself.”

Explanation:The claim is false; the poem was first published online in March 2020 by a retired teacher in the US during the novel coronavirus pandemic.

https://factcheck.afp.com/poem-was-written-2020-specifically-about-covid-19-pandemic

Claim: A video shows a family killed by the coronavirus amid China’s multi-city lockdown.
Explaination: False: The video does not show a family killed by the coronavirus amid China’s multi-city lockdown. The family was reported to have died of carbon monoxide poisoning in Dec 2019.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A video shows a family killed by the coronavirus amid China’s multi-city lockdown.

Explanation:False: The video does not show a family killed by the coronavirus amid China’s multi-city lockdown. The family was reported to have died of carbon monoxide poisoning in Dec 2019.

https://medium.com/annie-lab/false-this-video-does-not-show-a-family-killed-by-the-coronavirus-amid-chinas-multi-city-lockdown-4871af69fd6f

Claim: Photo on biography of a boy who died from coronavirus.
Explaination: The photo is incorrectly attributed to this story and is of an entirely different person unrelated to COVID-19.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Photo on biography of a boy who died from coronavirus.

Explanation:The photo is incorrectly attributed to this story and is of an entirely different person unrelated to COVID-19.

https://leadstories.com/hoax-alert/2020/04/fact-check-photo-on-biography-of-boy-who-died-of-coronavirus-is-NOT-ismail-mohamed-abdulwahab.html

Claim: OMS staff member is spreading coronavirus on purpose.
Explaination: The man is an astrophysicist, and he is touching this lady because she is his girlfriend, and she is sick.
Label: False
html:
Claim: OMS staff member is spreading coronavirus on purpose.

Explanation:The man is an astrophysicist, and he is touching this lady because she is his girlfriend, and she is sick.

Claim: Italians threw away their currency on the streets due to COVID-19 deaths.
Explaination: The images are from Venezuela where vandals robbed a bank and threw the demonetised money on the streets.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Italians threw away their currency on the streets due to COVID-19 deaths.

Explanation:The images are from Venezuela where vandals robbed a bank and threw the demonetised money on the streets.

https://www.boomlive.in/fake-news/did-italians-throw-their-money-on-the-streets-due-to-covid-19-deaths-7468

Claim: Sick COVID-19 patients at the airport runway in Senegal.
Explaination: Video is old and not from Italy. It actually shows mock drill carried out on 28 November 2019 at Blaise Diagne Airport in Dakar, the capital of Senegal. It has nothing to do with coronavirus.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Sick COVID-19 patients at the airport runway in Senegal.

Explanation:Video is old and not from Italy. It actually shows mock drill carried out on 28 November 2019 at Blaise Diagne Airport in Dakar, the capital of Senegal. It has nothing to do with coronavirus.

https://marathi.factcrescendo.com/old-video-of-mock-drill-at-senegal-airport-shared-as-from-italy-as-coronavirus-impact/

Claim: Punjab authorities have advised citizens not to eat goat meat for 60 days.
Explaination: China coronavirus: Pakistani officials deny they issued warning over dangers of eating goat meat.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Punjab authorities have advised citizens not to eat goat meat for 60 days.

Explanation:China coronavirus: Pakistani officials deny they issued warning over dangers of eating goat meat.

http://u.afp.com/PakistanGoats
